page.title: 12Living on a working farm.
page.content: Neil and Caroline Ashby live at Cookham Hill Farm,Skeet Hill Lane,which is a 70 acre farm .The children have lived on the farm all their lives and their grandfathers and great grandfathers have lived and farmed in the area. The farm produces cereals and market garden products such as cabbages ,brussel sprouts ,onions ,leeks,marrows,rhubarb and wallflowers.The glasshouses are used to grow flowers and bedding plants.The farming year is a very busy one because the intense cultivation practiced.Much of the work is done manually since many of the crops are harvested at different times.Mechanisation plays an important part in planting and cultivating the crops. A small number of people are employed to prepare and pack crops .
